snippet: A Danish court sentenced four men to 12-year prison terms for planning to attack the offices of a newspaper that printed cartoons depicting the prophet Muhammad.
abstract: Danish court convicts four men of planning a terrorist attack in 2010 against the offices of the newspaper Jyllands-Posten, sentencing them to 12 years in prison; the planned attack was intended as revenge for the newspaper's publication of 12 cartoons, many of them depicting the Prophet Muhammad.
lead_paragraph: A Danish court sentenced four men to 12-year prison terms for planning to attack the offices of a newspaper that printed cartoons depicting the prophet Muhammad.

headline.sub: Four Convicted in Terror Plot Against Danish Paper
headline.main: Four Convicted in Terror Plot Against Danish Paper
headline.print_headline: Denmark: 4 Convicted of Plot To Attack Newspaper’s Offices
